titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2123) to reauthorize the Head Start Act to improve the school readiness of disadvantaged children, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-229, by Mr. Bishop (UT).

It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Education and the Workforce now printed in the bill.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 92.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 455.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 189 (Roll no. 486).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/22/2005--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2123) to reauthorize the Head Start Act to improve the school readiness of disadvantaged children.
